remarks: If a vertex is adjacent to two different vertices in a simple graph, there are more than one edges starting at this vertex, analogous to ~ usgra2edg .  (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 10-Dec-2017.) (Revised by AV, 9-Jan-2020.)
statement:
usgvad2edg.e $e |- E = ( Edges ` G ) $.
usgvad2edg $p |- ( ( ( G e. USGrph /\ B =/= C ) /\ ( { N , B } e. E /\ { C , N } e. E ) ) -> E. x e. E E. y e. E ( x =/= y /\ N e. x /\ N e. y ) ) $.
$d B x y $.
$d C x y $.
$d E x y $.
$d G x y $.
$d N x y $.
